## R Markdown



```{r dataframe}
nv <- c(1,3,6,8) # numeric vector
cv <- c("a", "d", "f", "p") # Character vector
lv <- c(TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE) #Logical vector
df1 <- data.frame(nv, cv, lv)
```


```{r dataframe}
df2 <- data.frame(nv, cv, lv, row.names = c("Joe", "Bob", "Jill", "Sam"), 
                  stringsAsFactors = FALSE) #treats the strings as strings
df2
```

```{r}
rm("nv", "cv", "lv")
```


```{r}
df2
nv # we removed it and so we want to access it from the dataframe
df2$nv #gives the specific column
df2[[1]] #equivalent
```


```{r manipulate}
df2$nv <- df2$nv + 5 # can change the column nv within the dataframe
df2[c(1,3)] #extracts 1st and 3rd columns
df2[c("nv", "lv")] #extracts columns named nv and lv
df2
```
